headline: Micron’s US$24b Singapore Fab Raises Questions On AI Demand And Valuation
summary: Micron Technology plans to invest about $24b over the next decade to build a new advanced wafer fabrication facility in Singapore. The project is intended to expand cleanroom capacity, use AI and robotics in manufacturing, and create roughly 1,600 jobs. The move comes as the company responds to persistent global memory shortages and strong demand tied to AI infrastructure and data centric applications. Micron Technology (NasdaqGS: MU), trading at around $410.24, has experienced very large...

headline: ASML lifts 2026 outlook on record AI chip orders, plans 1,700 job cuts
summary: Giant chip equipment maker ASML reported record orders in the fourth quarter on Wednesday and boosted its 2026 outlook as demand surged from AI chipmakers including Nvidia, even as it cut management ​jobs to focus on engineering. The Dutch firm's orders exceeded expectations as the global chip market ramps up production capacity for the roll-out ‌of AI and data centers, with demand rising for the precision machines ASML makes that dominate the process for printing AI chips. ASML's fourth-quarter orders, the closest-watched metric in the industry, leapt ‌to a record 13.2 billion euros ($15.8 billion), from 7.1 billion euros a year ago.

content.title: ASML lifts 2026 outlook on record AI chip orders, plans 1,700 job cuts
content.summary: Giant chip equipment maker ASML reported record orders in the fourth quarter on Wednesday and boosted its 2026 outlook as demand surged from AI chipmakers including Nvidia, even as it cut management ​jobs to focus on engineering. The Dutch firm's orders exceeded expectations as the global chip market ramps up production capacity for the roll-out ‌of AI and data centers, with demand rising for the precision machines ASML makes that dominate the process for printing AI chips. ASML's fourth-quarter orders, the closest-watched metric in the industry, leapt ‌to a record 13.2 billion euros ($15.8 billion), from 7.1 billion euros a year ago.

headline: United States AI in Healthcare Market Forecast Report and Company Analysis 2025-2033 Featuring AWS, General Vision, Google, Intel, Medtronic, Micron, Microsoft, Next IT, NVIDIA, Siemens Healthcare
summary: The United States AI in Healthcare Market is projected to soar from US$ 10.26 billion in 2025 to US$ 99.77 billion by 2033, growing at a CAGR of 32.88%. This growth is driven by digital transformation, precision medicine demand, government support, and the need for cost-effective healthcare. AI applications like predictive analytics and medical imaging improve care efficiency and accuracy. The industry's expansion benefits from AI-enhanced clinical decision-making, personalized medicine, and NLP
